channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree overhanging front garden and road, 12th September
item.description:
The tree on the verge outside our house is seriously top-heavy and overhanging both our garden and the road. Yesterday a mature tree on the verge came down near no 59 Kenwood Drive. The trunk broke at the bottom. Please arrange for roadside Trees to be health checked by the council in case of more accidents and possible injury to people. Trees need pruning to remove too-heavy canopies in wind, causing them to topple..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kenwood Drive, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More flags intimidating the public and obstructing road signage, 12th September
item.description:
Union flags posted by 3am fascists. This time they are obstructing roundabout signage, so whether Bexley like it or not (I suspect they support these far right vandals) they have a duty of care to remove them
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ruxley Corner, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracked and uneven pavement, 12th September
item.description:
This is almost a year since first reported. Are has been spray painted for repair twice but no further action. When I’ve chased it up over the phone nobody seems to know what I’m talking about! It’s a dangerous trip hazard for pedestrians and school children

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Manor Way, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 12th September

item.title: Overgrowth restricting pavement, 12th September
item.description:
